state_analysis: The test script continues to fail due to improperly formatted escape characters, which lead to syntax errors when the script is executed. Each attempt to run the script results in repeated errors.
explanation: I will recreate the test script again, ensuring that I avoid any problematic characters and properly format the script without escape sequences that cause issues. After creating the script successfully, I will run it to verify the functionality of the solve function.

commands.keystrokes:
echo "import numpy as np
from grid_transform import solve

test_input = [[8, 6], [6, 4]]
expected_output = [[8, 6, 8, 6, 8, 6], [6, 4, 6, 4, 6, 4], [6, 8, 6, 8, 6, 8], [4, 6, 4, 6, 4, 6], [8, 6, 8, 6, 8, 6], [6, 4, 6, 4, 6, 4]]
result = solve(test_input)
assert result == expected_output, f'Expected {expected_output}, but got {result}'
print('Test passed!')" > test_script.py
